result.execSummary:
The defendant Monica De Los Angeles Verhelst-Watts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Rock County Ordinance - Disorderly Conduct-DV. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Monica De Los Angeles Verhelst-Watts

records.addlTxt: 1:01 PM Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Monica De Los Angeles Verhelst-Watts not in court.  Attorney Richard Russell McCue Jr appeared by video for Monica De Los Angeles Verhelst-Watts. Amended Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. No Contest plea entered on behalf of Defendant. Court finds Defendant guilty and orders a $10 forfeiture and costs due within 60 days.
Copy of scheduled appointments at CHS Beloit Behavioral Health Deptartment
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Sworn Spanish interpreter Victor Gonzalez appeared as interpreter for defendant.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Adjourned initial appearance on February 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
